Very good. And any late items? No? Okay, let's go on. Confirmation of the order of meeting. I'll move in a second. Was that Jim? And thank you.  Thank you. In favour? Aye. Against? Passed. Okay, we're just going to go minutes of the last meeting, which was July, June the 24th. So these are pages 7, pages 8, 9, 10 and 11.  Any details, any questions? A mover and a seconder, please. I'll move. And Phillip will second. All in favour? Aye. And against? Passed, thank you. Okay, now we're very quickly moving to the next point of issue. Here we go. This is the presentation. Now I'm guessing that  Shelly has arrived. Oh there she is. Hello, welcome to this meeting and we're just presenting now for your  Report, would you like to take us forward through that?
speaker: relwynandre

text: Yeah, sure. I'll just cover off just a bit of a high-level summary of the report, if that was OK, and I'll just take the rest of it as read and go from there in terms of any comments or questions around the summary. Is that acceptable? Yeah, we'll be fine. Yeah, so the purpose of the report is basically just to report back on the consultation that was undertaken. I think you guys, the committee, saw this in May earlier in the year. So we've been out and we've sought feedback.  And so this paper is just really just trying to get your endorsement around the summary of submissions and proposed recommendations prior to going to the Council Committee on the 6th of October. So the summary document and recommended changes has also been supported by the reference group and been working with them in terms of developing these. We've received 21 submissions.  and 134 points across the board around all the different sections. So the submission form was open, basically, for each chapter in the RMP that they could support, oppose or be neutral or provide some commentary around that. So that's where the 134 comes from. Of those submission points, there was 25 that had comments in that. So that is what's been summarised in the submission summary report and a bit of a high-level summary around the support, oppose, neutral in terms of  how they—what their status is on the chapter. Yes. So of the 25 comments that we did receive, there was some four key points, which is also summarised in your report.  So, yeah, I don't know if there's any questions around those. The big one really was around the cultural harvesting and just making sure we give that proper recognition. Yeah, so that's pretty much the high-level summary. You'll also note in the submission summary report as well that there's a few submitters that were said submitter details withheld, and that is because they've had checked the box that they don't want their details public. So that's why they're there. Most of those, I think, only put a support of pros or neutrals on each of the topic matters.  Yeah, but that is a very high level summary around those. Is that enough detail if I've taken the report as read or how would you like to proceed on that? Perhaps is there any questions from the rest of the committee?
speaker: shelleymonrad

text: I see that we've had a couple of suggestions around dogs and the response to that and the process. Is that a comfortable one to be allowing? Yep.

text: So it's just broadening out the definition there and being accurate around assistance to dogs, rather than just saying aye.

text: The point brought up about poison use. I mean, is that currently done or is that something to do more with trapping and that kind of thing? I didn't realise that poison was actively used.
